issues.description: The problem statement (and the integration test instructions in it) refer to REST endpoints using the path prefix "/api" (e.g. "PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents"), but the provided controller classes in both the template and solution repositories expose the endpoints without that prefix (e.g. "PUT /persons/{personId}/parents"). This mismatch between the documented endpoint paths and the actual controller mappings can confuse students when they write integration tests or try to call the endpoints as described in the text. It may cause students to call the wrong URL ("/api/..."), resulting in failing tests or unexpected 404 errors even though the implementation is correct.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the URL paths consistent between the problem statement and the code. Either (A) update the problem statement and its integration-test instructions to use the actual paths exposed by the controllers (e.g. "PUT /persons/{personId}/parents"), or (B) change the controller mappings to include the "/api" prefix (for example add a class-level @RequestMapping("/api") or adjust existing @RequestMapping values) and update any tests accordingly. Choose one approach and apply it consistently across documentation, template code, and solution code so students are not misled by differing endpoint paths.

issues.description: Problem statement refers to the web layer controller as `PersonController` while both the template and solution code declare the class as `PersonResource`. This creates a small mapping friction: students reading the textual description may search for a `PersonController` class but find `PersonResource` in the provided codebase.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the problem statement to refer to `PersonResource` (so the textual description matches the provided code), or rename the class in the template and solution from `PersonResource` to `PersonController`. Prefer updating the problem statement if the codebase already uses `PersonResource` consistently.

issues.description: The problem statement's integration-test instructions reference endpoints with an `/api` prefix (e.g. `PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents`), but the template and solution controllers expose endpoints at the root paths (e.g. `PUT /persons/{personId}/parents`). This mismatch can mislead students when they attempt to call endpoints or write integration tests based on the textual description.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the documented endpoint paths and the code. Either (a) update the problem statement to use the actual paths (e.g. `PUT /persons/{personId}/parents`), or (b) add a consistent `/api` base path to the controller (for example change the controller's annotation to @RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes = {...}, produces = {...}) so endpoints become `/api/persons/...`). Choose the approach that matches course conventions; updating the problem statement is the lower-risk fix if the code/ tests already use the root paths.
